definitions.definition: Away from the inside or centre .
examples: The magician tapped the hat, and a rabbit jumped out .
There was a hole in the bucket, and all the water leaked out .

definitions.definition: Away from, or at a distance from, some point of reference or focus.
examples: Once they had landed, the commandos quickly spread out along the beach.
For six hours the tide flows out , then for six hours it flows in.
He lives out in Australia.
It's three miles out to the island.
The Joneses don't live here any more. They moved out three months ago.

subdefinitions.definition: Specifically, away from home or one's usual place.
examples: Let’s eat out tonight

subdefinitions.definition: Away from the doer, especially vigorously.
examples: hit out , lash out , speak out , shout out , yell out

definitions.definition: Away, or at a distance, in time (relative to, and usually after, the present or a stated event) ( often preceded by a stated time period and followed by "from" )
examples: Five years out from the passing of the law, nothing had actually changed.
The election is a long way out .
Last night we slept out under the stars.
It's cold out .

definitions.definition: Of the ball or other playing implement, so as to pass or be situated beyond the bounds of the playing area.
examples: The football caught the edge of the line but then bounced out .

definitions.definition: Into a state of non-operation or non-existence.
examples: Turn the lights out .
Put the fire out .
I painted out that nasty mark on the wall.

definitions.definition: To the end; completely; so that nothing remains.
examples: I haven’t finished. Hear me out .
Sorry love, we've got no bananas. We've sold out .

subdefinitions.definition: Shows that an activity has been completed to the point of exhaustion.
examples: After hours at the party, she was all danced out .
The place was all decked out for the holidays.

definitions.definition: Into a state of existence or visibility.
examples: The singer is bringing out a new album next month.
The sun has brought the flowers out .

subdefinitions.definition: So as to be visible in the sky, and not covered by clouds, fog, etc.
examples: The sun came out after the rain, and we saw a rainbow.
subdefinitions.label_groups: of the sun, moon, stars, etc.

definitions.definition: So as to be disqualified from playing further by some action of a member of the opposing team (such as being stumped in cricket).
examples: Wilson was bowled out for five runs.

main_definition: Away from the inside or centre .
secondary_definitions: Away from, or at a distance from, some point of reference or focus.
( informal ) Away, or at a distance, in time (relative to, and usually after, the present or a stated event) ( often preceded by a stated time period and followed by "from" )
( sports ) Of the ball or other playing implement, so as to pass or be situated beyond the bounds of the playing area.
Into a state of non-operation or non-existence.
To the end; completely; so that nothing remains.
Into a state of existence or visibility.
( cricket , baseball , of a player ) So as to be disqualified from playing further by some action of a member of the opposing team (such as being stumped in cricket).
